I say we go along with the toymakers and say Animorphs, and 
Transformers are the same universe. All the races Yerks, Andalites, 
Hork-Bajir, and Taxxons (and dozens of others in the Ellimist 
Chronicles) would be fairly primitive at this point. Let's go to their 
homeworlds.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@p...> wrote:
> there's a whole universe to explore, and we're dealing with a race 
of robots that can blend in anywhere. We have intelligent, imaginitive 
people in this RPG, the possabilities are endless. I think we should 
have one on the final frontier and see what happens. Transformers took 
trips to Junkion, Nebulos, Char, and at least a dozen unnamed planets 
in the cartoon. Go into the comic and you'll find Hydrus 4 and other 
planets that were never mentioned in the cartoon. If this group can't 
find a way to explore a universe of possabilities then we're pathetic.
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Legendarynemasis@a... 
>   To: nbwrpg@y... 
>   Sent: Wednesday, November 21, 2001 12:41 PM
>   Subject: Re: Debate (important everyone read)
> 
> 
>          You may have kept the people from going off Cybertron code, 
which would be unrealistic for Cybertrons. If we could expand the RPG 
past one singular world then that would create excitement and people 
would post more often as there would be more to do. Storys could bloom 
and develop as charachter can interact with new things. Rather then 
everyone just fighting each other all the time and being fenced in.
